action.primary: Drains Damp-Heat from the Urinary Bladder, promotes urination and unblocks painful urinary dysfunction

indications: Damp-Heat Painful Urinary Dysfunction, especially Blood Lin

action.primary: Breaks up Blood Stasis, invigorates Blood circulation and regulates menstruation
Purges Heart and Small Intestine Fire

indications: Heart Fire leading to Small Intestine Excess Heat

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with urinary difficulty postpartum.
Contraindicated for those with edema due to Spleen Deficiency.
Contraindicated for elderly and deficient patients with urinary blockage when it is not due to Damp-Heat.
incompatibilities: Antagonizes Ootheca Mantidis #{SangPiaoXiao} Sang Piao Xiao.
interactions: Concurrent use with diuretics such as chlorothiazide, hydrochlorothiazide, furmoside (Lasix), bumetinide (Bumex) and torsemide (Demadex) may lead to increased elimination of water and/or electrolytes.

useCases: Lower Jiao Damp-Heat with burning, painful, dribbling urination.
Heat dysuria (Re Lin) with burning and pain during urination.

notes: This herb is most appropriate when Heat is predominant.
This herb can be used for gynecological swellings and sores and other skin rashes due to Damp-Heat.
One source says that this herb is good for Obstruction Syndrome with frequent vomiting, difficult urination and/or defecation, masses and distention.
This herb has been shown to inhibit the growth of cancer cells.
It is said that the leaves cure anal fistula, hematochezia, ascariasis, ophthalmia, female tinea sores and detoxifies mineral toxicity.
For a carbuncle on the tip of the thumb, burn the herb to ash, blend with vegetable oil and apply to the lesion.
Take the powder orally for a sore throat.
This herb is also used for promoting contractions in case of prolonged pregnancy or uterine dystocia.

Both Qu Mai and Hb. Polygoni Avicularis #{BianXu} Bian Xu clear Heat and facilitate the removal of pathogenic water to unblock painful urinary dysfunction. They are often used together to treat burning, painful and difficult urination Bian Xu is bitter, directs downward and directly enters the Bladder to cool Damp-Heat and is superior for scanty, dark and difficult -to-pass urine due to Damp-Heat. It can also be used for Damp-Heat jaundice. Qu Mai facilitates the function of the Small Intestine to guide Internal Heat outward and is better for burning pain during urination or hematuria due to Heat. It also breaks up blood Stasis and unblocks the channels to treat amenorrhea.
Aerial Parts of Dianthus Qu Mai Sui are superior for cooling Heat, facilitating urination, breaking up Blood Stasis and unblocking the channels.
